intro: Racosperma georgense, commonly known as the Georgian raceme tree, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Georgia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually clustered in racemes and can be pale yellow to reddish in color. Racosperma georgense is adapted to temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soils.
